item.title: Euro Could Extend Gains on Upcoming Data
item.description: The euro could extend its rise against the dollar if eurozone wage data remains elevated and U.S. economic data is weaker, ING said.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise on Downbeat U.S. Dollar, Rate Cut Hopes
item.description: Gold futures rose after reaching a record in early Asian trading on persistent dollar weakness, but Swissquote Bank reckons a rebound in the currency is plausible.

item.title: Gilt Yields Edge Lower in Absence of Key Data Releases
item.description: Gilt yields declined in the absence of market-moving data releases on Monday and ahead of U.K. public finances data and preliminary PMI data later this week.

item.title: Oil Prices Fall as China Demand Concerns Offset Supply Risks
item.description: Oil prices fell, as the prospect of weak demand in China offset any gains from risks to supply, with apparent demand in the country falling 8% on year in July according to government data, ANZ Research said.

item.title: Rheinmetall Falls on Reports of German Military Aid Cut to Ukraine
item.description: The German government is set to stop meeting new requests for military support from Kyiv with immediate effect, the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung reported on Saturday.

item.title: 7-Eleven Operator Mulls Bid From Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard
item.description: Seven & i Holdings, the Japanese operator of 7-Eleven convenience stores and other retail chains, is studying a takeover offer from Canadian convenience store operator Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: U.K. Rate Cut Invigorates Property Market
item.description: U.K. property demand rose after the Bank of England’s rate cut in August, while the average price of property coming to the market fell from July’s average price, according to data from Rightmove.

item.title: What Kamala Harris Has to Prove at the Democratic National Convention
item.description: The presidential race has been upended in the last few weeks, with Kamala Harris now at the top of the Democratic ticket. WSJ’s Aaron Zitner explains what’s at stake for the party at the Democratic convention.

item.title: The U.K. Stamped Out Anti-Immigration Riots---Now Comes the Hard Part
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is credited for quickly reasserting law and order to the streets. Now he must address the root causes of the riots, in particular, concerns about near-record levels of both legal and illegal immigration.

item.title: Pepper…and Salt
Runaround (Monday Crossword, August 19)
What's News: World-Wide
What's News: Business and Finance
Thai Economy Improves But Uncertainty Lingers
item.description: Thailand’s economy grew slightly more than expected in the second quarter from a year earlier, but uncertainty over the outlook remains as a new prime minister takes the reins.

item.title: Expelled former congressman George Santos was expected to plead guilty to criminal charges, according to people familiar with the matter, averting a trial for the New York Republican that was scheduled for next month.
item.description: Expelled former congressman George Santos was expected to plead guilty to criminal charges, according to people familiar with the matter, averting a trial for the New York Republican that was scheduled for next month.

item.title: Russian conscript soldiers taken prisoner during Ukraine's incursion into Russia pose a threat to Putin's credibility after he promised that professionals only would participate in active combat against Kyiv's forces.
item.description: Russian conscript soldiers taken prisoner during Ukraine’s incursion into Russia pose a threat to Putin’s credibility after he promised that professionals only would participate in active combat against Kyiv’s forces.

item.title: Law-enforcement officials and protest organizers said they intend to maintain the peace at this year's Democratic National Convention in Chicago, a city that was the scene of widely televised violence at the event in 1968.
item.description: Law-enforcement officials and protest organizers said they intend to maintain the peace at this year’s Democratic National Convention in Chicago, a city that was the scene of widely televised violence at the event in 1968.

item.title: Some Trump allies warn that he risks squandering his opportunity to return to the White House if the candidate fails to stick to the issues and continues to indulge in personal attacks against his opponent.
item.description: Some Trump allies warn that he risks squandering his opportunity to return to the White House if the candidate fails to stick to the issues and continues to indulge in personal attacks against his opponent.

item.title: Democratic voters' energy for Kamala Harris spread to a series of critical races in California, and the party's congressional candidates are hoping to use it to win back the House of Representatives.
item.description: Democratic voters’ energy for Kamala Harris spread to a series of critical races in California, and the party’s congressional candidates are hoping to use it to win back the House of Representatives.

item.title: Young Americans are embracing a rent-first lifestyle, preferring to try out goods from furniture to everyday clothing rather than committing to ownership.
item.description: Young Americans are embracing a rent-first lifestyle, preferring to try out goods from furniture to everyday clothing rather than committing to ownership.
